resources.string: This will open the built in camera of the mobile phone.
This opens the gallery and enables the user to select banknote images.
It is an application that will detect a counterfeit banknote. Mainly the 500 and 1000 peso bill.

It allows the users to capture Philippine banknote to verify authenticity using the mobile built-in camera. The user can also select an image from his/her mobile gallery. It will then generate a list of security features; to serve as a guide for the users to be aware of the banknoteâ€™s security features and determine if the banknote is authentic or counterfeit.
Embossed Prints - Raised prints that feel rough to the touch
Serial Number - Composed of 1 or 2 prefix letters and 6 or 7 asymmetric (increasing size) digits located at the lower left and upper right corners of the face of the note.
Security Fibers - Red and blue visible fibers embedded on the paper at random and glow in two colors under ultravioler light.
Watermark - A shadow image of the portratit and the numeral seen at the blank space of the note when viewed against the light from either side of the note
See-Through Mark - The word "PILIPINO" written in Baybayin (pre-Spanish Philippine writing system) is seen in complete from when the note is viewed against the light.
Concelead Value = The denominational value superimposed on the smaller version portrait at the upper left side of the note, which becomes obvious when the note is rotated 45 degree and tilted down.

Security Thread - A stitch-like metallic thread running vertically across the note which changed color from red to green. The front of the thread bears the alphanumeric of the banknote in cleartext while the back is imprinted with "BSP", both in repeated series.

Optically Variable Device - A reflective foil that bears the image of back of the banknote inside of it is a small BSP Logo. The color of the image changes from red to green when the note is rotated at 90 degree.
Oprically Variable Ink - Embossed Banknote denominational value at the lower right corner of the face of the note that changes color from green to blue when viewed at different angles.
